page.title: 04 Family life in Polstead.
page.content: Many families remain in the village who are direct descendants of those whose names are on the gravestones and monuments of Polstead church.These families are mainly local farmers. Retired people are attracted to the village and enjoy walking, gardening,and participating in village activities.Families are attracted to settle in Polstead by the advantages of living in the country and having space for children to play,to keep ponies,a few have their own swimming pools and tennis courts. People tend to stay in Polstead,few move away.House prices are high compared with neighbouring towns, (60,000 pounds being currently asked for a small 1950's two bedroomed bungalow on a reasonably sized plot.) Families care well for their children, one parent families being rare.
